page.title: 16The Anchor Butter Factory
page.content: Near to the motorway,Anchor Foods,the manufacturers and importers of New Zealand butter ,have built a large {butter and cheese packing factory}. 18 pints of milk goes into making 1 pound of butter which is then shipped to Swindon for packing for the large retail outlets Sainsbury's,Tesco,Spar and Carrefour.As well as butter, cream , cheese and fruit syrups are processed in the factory which provides{jobs for 350 people }. The factory,a large butter coloured building,contains a sound proofed {viewing area}above the production line and a lecture room so that schools and other groups visiting can learn about the process involved . Over 5m. packs of butter are sold in the shops every week delivered by Anchor's fleet of 26 lorries .
